topic.title: The Cellar Restaurant
topic.shortdesc: The Cellar offers a lot of great menu items to dip into ranch... but the ranch isn't anything to write home about.

body.p: The main thing lacking from The Cellar's ranch dressing is a hint of runniness. The flavor is solid, all of the right spices, but the consistency kind of makes you feel like you're eating ranch from a veggie tray at a child's birthday party. I wouldn't call it sour cream consistency, but I definitely wouldn't call it Ken's Buttermilk Ranch either. I will say, however, that The Cellar serves ranch in a considerably larger dipping cup that it's competition.

fig.title: The Cellar: Decent ranch, but not the best...

image.alt: Image of the outside of The Cellar Restaurant

body.p: The consistency alone keeps The Cellar's ranch from rising any higher than the third best in Blacksburg. I am sure this ranch is fairly easy to squeeze... The Cellar should be thankful that the place that sells them their dipping sauce cups makes them big, because that's the only thing that kept them in the top three.
